title: Building a Brush Raft with Two Ponchos
brief: Step-by-step construction of a brush raft that can support 115 kilograms.
steps: Step 1: Push hood of each poncho to inner side and tie off necks tightly using drawstrings.
Step 2: Attach ropes or vines at corner and side grommets of each poncho, making them long enough to cross and tie with opposite corners.
Step 3: Spread first poncho on ground inner side up, pile fresh green brush (no thick branches) 45 centimeters high.
Step 4: Pull drawstring up through center of brush stack.
Step 5: Make X-frame from two small saplings and place on top of brush stack, tie securely with drawstring.
Step 6: Add another 45 centimeters of brush on top of X-frame and compress slightly.
Step 7: Pull poncho sides up around brush and tie diagonally corner to corner and side to side with attached ropes.
Step 8: Spread second poncho inner side up next to brush bundle.
Step 9: Roll brush bundle onto second poncho with tied side down.
Step 10: Tie second poncho around bundle same as first poncho.
Step 11: Place in water with tied side of second poncho facing up.
warnings: Use only fresh green brush - dead or dry brush will not provide adequate buoyancy.
Test raft in water before loading equipment to ensure it floats properly.
Do not drag raft on ground as this can puncture or tear the poncho material.
